Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client

Class LDAPClient

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Connector
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Client
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client.LDAPClient
public class LDAPClient extends Client
LDAP client implementation that creates and manages LDAP client connections.

This class extends Client to provide LDAP-specific client functionality for connecting to LDAP servers and creating connection instances.

Standalone Usage


 // Simple - no Gumdrop setup needed
 LDAPClient client = new LDAPClient("ldap.example.com", 389);
 client.connect(new LDAPConnectionReady() {
     public void handleReady(LDAPConnected connection) {
         connection.bind("cn=admin,dc=example,dc=com", "secret",
             new BindResultHandler() {
                 public void handleBindSuccess(LDAPSession session) {
                     // Perform searches, modifications, etc.
                     session.search(request, new MySearchHandler());
                 }
                 public void handleBindFailure(LDAPResult result, LDAPConnected conn) {
                     conn.unbind();
                 }
             });
     }
     // ... other callbacks
 });

Server Integration (with SelectorLoop affinity)


 // Use the same SelectorLoop as your server connection
 LDAPClient client = new LDAPClient(connection.getSelectorLoop(), "ldap.example.com", 389);
 client.connect(handler);

LDAPS (implicit TLS)


 LDAPClient client = new LDAPClient("ldap.example.com", 636);
 client.setSecure(true);
 client.setKeystoreFile("/path/to/truststore.p12");
 client.connect(handler);
Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Constructor Details

    • LDAPClient

      public LDAPClient(String host, int port) throws UnknownHostException
      Creates an LDAP client that will connect to the specified host and port.

      The Gumdrop infrastructure is managed automatically - it starts when Client.connect(T) is called and stops when all connections close.

      Parameters:
      host - the LDAP server host as a String
      port - the LDAP server port number (typically 389 or 636)
      Throws:
      UnknownHostException - if the host cannot be resolved

    • LDAPClient

    • LDAPClient

      public LDAPClient(SelectorLoop selectorLoop, String host, int port) throws UnknownHostException
      Creates an LDAP client that will connect to the specified host and port, using the provided SelectorLoop for I/O.

      Use this constructor for server integration where you want the client to share a SelectorLoop with server connections for efficiency.

      Parameters:
      selectorLoop - the SelectorLoop for connection I/O
      host - the LDAP server host as a String
      port - the LDAP server port number (typically 389 or 636)
      Throws:
      UnknownHostException - if the host cannot be resolved

    • LDAPClient

    • newConnection

      protected Connection newConnection(SocketChannel channel, SSLEngine engine, ClientHandler handler)
      Creates a new LDAP client connection with a handler.
      Specified by:
      newConnection in class Client
      Parameters:
      channel - the socket channel for the connection
      engine - optional SSL engine for secure connections
      handler - the client handler to receive LDAP events (must be LDAPConnectionReady)
      Returns:
      a new LDAPClientConnection instance
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if handler is not an LDAPConnectionReady
